reviewText: A cheap and cheerful arcade racing game based on an old iteration of the chrome engine (Call of Juarez etc.) The graphics are not the best by today's standards but the game doesn't cost much these days either. The cars are all Volkswagons, from the early eighties Golf GTi to late 90's concept, old and new Beetles are included and even the VW Camper. You can customise most of the parts, by winning races and spending your prize money, but this is not a sim. Most customisations make very little difference to performance unless they boost the BHP. It takes some practice to consistently win events and opponents are challenging but a bit stupidly rough, bashing you off the track if they can. A real bonus in a game like this is the availabilty of a cockpit view, making it more realistic and challenging. It's fun, works with a Logitech wheel, and it took me 25 hours to complete so the value can't be questioned. Worth a try if you're stuck for some racing action.

reviewText: GTI Racing is a game where you race variants of the VW vehicles that's GTI, from the Bettle to Golf, and more. There are variety of courses, but some are simply running the same course in reverse, or have a slightly variant route. You can also spend some of your earnings to improve your vehicle in various ways, from improved ECM to racing tires, from improved exhaust to turbocharger. This is an arcade racer, where the idea is not to make mistakes and still go fast. Graphics are decent, but that's all. It's an arcade racer, and a budget title. You can find better racing games cheaper.

reviewText:
This is a five dollar game.
I'm going to begin with that.
If you expect fantastic graphics and super realistic physics, you aren't going to find them here.
If you expect to be able to drift a VW Bus at 150 kph like you're in Initial D, you've come to the right place.
There are tons of races that you can do in career mode. You can modify and upgrade your cars to a surprising degree. The gameplay is addicting. The cars handle more like go-karts than actual cars, so feel free to slide through a corner at nearly top speed with minimal braking.
Yes, the physics do get weird at times, and the visual customization kinda sucks, and you do occasionally get stuck in the barriers at times, but remember, it's a five dollar game made to advertise Volkswagen. This wasn't meant to be a super amazing game, but that's the amazing thing. It is. I've spent more time on this game than I ever thought I would. I keep playing it even after I've beaten it.
Please, give this game a chance. It's worth it.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
All around fun little racing game. Has around 70 single player races (which can take around 6 or 7 hours), and has around 30 or so volkswagon cars. The cars are in different catregories by how powerful they are, so if you want a nice fast car, it will take a while.

There are some little glitches I found, not game breaking but they are still annoying at times when they do happen. First glitch, is when you drive fast into a barrier. If you do so, you will get stuck in the wall, but good thing there is a reset button (R) on the keyboard. Next one, is kind of a glitch, or maybe it is just really weird. When you try to cut corners on some of the tracks, your car will jump up and spin around, but luckily most of the time you will just end up facing the way you wanted to go.

There is multiplayer, I have seen a few people on it, but don't expect there to be a whole lot of people playing this 10 year old game.

Also, there is no controller support, so if you were hoping to use your wheel or controller then you probably shouldn't pick this game up if you do not like using the keyboard for racing games.
